tn.ref: Maacah, the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah
the golden calves that Jeroboam made as gods
tn.text: This is a reference to idols.

tn.ref: Whoever comes to consecrate himself with a young bullock and seven rams may become a priest of what are no gods
tn.text: AT: "Anyone who offers a young bull and seven rams may become a priest of these golden calves that are not gods."
The "bread of the presence" was a special kind of bread that was made as a symbol of God's presence and of his fellowship with his people.
AT: "they also take care of the lampstand"
AT: "a surprise attack behind the army of Judah"
AT: "the surprise attack was behind the army of Judah"

tn.ref: it came about that God struck
Jeshanah with its villages, and Ephron with its villages
tn.text: Jeshanah and Ephron were villages that belonged to the kingdom of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
